meanings.definition: To serve as a sign or warning of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds harbingering a storm.
meanings.sent2: The howling wind harbingering the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds harbingering the start of a new day.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder harbingering trouble ahead.
meanings.sent5: The sudden silence harbingering an impending danger.

meanings.definition: To announce or indicate the approach of something.
meanings.sent1: The ringing bell harbingering the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh bread harbingering a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog harbingering the arrival of guests.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums harbingering a parade.
meanings.sent5: The first snowflakes harbingering the onset of winter.

meanings.sent1: The old saying harbingering the wisdom of the elders.
meanings.sent2: The eerie silence harbingering an imminent danger.
meanings.sent3: The sudden drop in temperature harbingering a cold front.
meanings.sent4: The distant howl of a wolf harbingering a lonely night.
meanings.sent5: The rustling leaves harbingering the arrival of autumn.
